title: 汉化.xml内容 只要里面文本一有中文就打不开了 有谁知道为啥
author: 熊尼玛
txt_content:
本帖最后由 lichi2050 于 2016-2-4 19:21 编辑             Introduction         The Factory Module of Mariculture introduces a few different machines and blocks to help out in various different situations, this book will help describe their functionalities to you.         Settings         A lot of the blocks throughout Mariculture can let you either adjust their auto-eject settings or redstone mode in their interface. Here's a little about each mode.         Redstone Mode         Disabled - This block will not react to redstone signals         Low - This block will work unless it has a redstone signal         High - This block will only work with a redstone signal         Eject Setting         Disabled - This Block will not auto-eject anything         Items - This block will auto-eject items         Fluids - This block will auto-eject fluids         Items & Fluids - Block auto-ejects both items and fluids                   Automatic Dictionary Converter         This block can convert Ore Dictionary equivalent items from one to another. Other than the block all you need is one item that you would like to convert. You do not need the target item. Simply in the converter interface, place the item you want to convert in the slots on the left side of the machine and it'll place a ghost item. You can then left click this item and it will cycle through all of the ore dictionary equivalent items! Then simply place the item you want to convert in the input slot on the right and it will quickly convert the item for you. (Right click to remove item from the top slots). You can also middle click the items, to change the ore dictionary name the looping is associated with, if an item has more than one Ore Dictionary entry. If you run out of room in the 24 slots, you can place item filters (right click them to edit their contents), in the slots instead, allowing for up to 216 filters.                      |writable_book|             feather|pearl|feather             ingotCopper|baseWood|ingotCopper             autodictionary                               wicker||wicker             wicker|net|wicker             |wicker|blank             filter                          Sawmill & Plans         The sawmill can be used to create various different custom blocks, with different textures on each face. You can make one way mirrors this way. You will need plans in order to operate the sawmill.         Plans         Plans are made by taking a blank plan and some planning chalk, and making sure they are both in your inventory then right click with the chalk on a block with similiar properties to what you want to make a plan of. For example right click a torch if you want a custom lighting plan, or right click stairs for stairs plan.                      dyeBlue|dyeBlack|             paper|dyeBlue|             ||             plan_blank                               limestoneraw||             limestoneraw||             dyeWhite||             chalk                          Using the Sawmill         First of all place your plan in one of the left three slots. (Right click the slot to change which is selected). Then place the blocks you want to use as the sides in the other 6 slots on the left. The 4 middle rows are NESW, while the other are top/bottom. You can use feathers in place of any of the block faces, and that side will be completely invisible. If you want to speed up the sawmill, you can use hyperkinetic upgrades. Take note that if you are confused you can place hoppers on the side of the sawmill and the blocks will go in the corresponding slots. You can also rotate the blocks in the world, if you right click them with a Blacksmith's Hammer.                      blank|iron_axe|blank             slabWood|logWood|slabWood             ingotCopper|baseWood|ingotCopper             sawmill                          Plan Types         This is a list of all the plan types and what you need to right click on to get them                  Floor Plan         Carpets                  Block Plan         Any normal blocks, that don't emit light                  Stair Plan         Stairs                  Slab Plan         Slabs                  Fence Plan         Fences                  Gate Plan         Gates                  Wall Plan         Walls                  Light Plan         Any block that's emitting light                  RF Plan         Any block that handles Redstone Flux                 Paintbrush         The Paintbrush allows you to paint any existing custom blocks in the world. In order to do this you will need to shift + right click on the block you want to steal the texture from, this will get assigned to the brush. You can then simply right click (or in the case of gates shift + right click), and then you will paint that side the texture. This is the cheapest way to get decorative. If you want to paint a side invisible, simply shift + right click on any custom block, and it will set the texture to air. (Doesn't work on Gates)                      |wool|wool             |aluminumBlock|wool             sawmill||             paintbrush                          Power Generation         There are a few machines in Mariculture that run off of Redstone Flux. This is a power system created by Team COFH, makers of Thermal Expansion. As of right now Mariculture introduces one new way to produce Redstone Flux. This is by the creation of a water turbine. To create this, you will need to create a rotor, a sluice, iron construction blocks and a generator.                      ingotIron|glass_pane|ingotIron             glass_pane||glass_pane             ingotIron|glass_pane|ingotIron             baseIron                               |battery.copper|             comparator|ingotMagnesium|comparator             dustRedstone|baseIron|dustRedstone             generator                          Rotor Types         There are three different kinds of rotor. Copper, Aluminium and Titanium. Each is better than the previous, able to produce more power. To install these rotors simply right click them on to an iron construction block, and it will turn in to a spinning rotor in world.                      |ingotCopper|             ingotCopper|slabWood|ingotCopper             |ingotCopper|             turbine.copper                               |ingotAluminum|             ingotAluminum|stone_slab|ingotAluminum             |ingotAluminum|             turbine.aluminum                               |ingotTitanium|             ingotTitanium|stone_slab 7|ingotTitanium             |ingotTitanium|             turbine.titanium                          Water Turbine         In order to construct a water turbine, you simply place a rotor next to pressurised water. Ensure your rotors are connected to a generator and it will produce power from that generator. See the image below.                          Sluice         The sluice has a couple of functions. It can pull fluids out of a tank, or place them in. The larger side is the output face, while the narrower side is the input. The Sluice's main function however is to generate pressurised water, to be used in your water turbines. You need to build a water tower behind them, the higher the tower, the more water they will produce. Sluice's produce water every 10 seconds so you may need a bunch of them to power your turbines. (Pressurised water damages terrain)                               |minecraft:hopper|             wheel|iron_bars|wheel             ingotAluminum|baseIron|ingotAluminum             sluice                          Advanced Sluice         Works pretty much the same as the normal sluice but produces more water. It can also be used to fill in large areas with a fluid, instead of only placing one block.                      ingotTitanium|hpwater|ingotTitanium             ingotTitanium|Mariculture:upgrade 12|ingotTitanium             ingotTitanium|sluice|ingotTitanium             sluiceAdvanced                               logWood|logWood|logWood             logWood|crafting_table|logWood             logWood|baseWood|logWood             unpacker                  Unpacker         This block performs 1x1 crafting recipes. Input an item to the top via a hopper, and the result can be pulled from the bottom of the block.                 Fish Sorter         The Fish Sorter, allows you to sort your fish based upon their species. It can also sort other items. In order to set it up you, need to place the item you want to sort on the right hand side, in one of the many slots. You can then click on the slot and it will cycle between all the different colours. A colour representing a side of the block. Items will then only be allowed to be pulled from that side of the block, by pipes from other mods or hoppers. You can also click the square on the left to change the default side.                      dyeBlack|pearl|dyeYellow             dyeGreen|fish|dyeCyan             dyeRed|baseWood|dyeWhite             fishSorter                          Mechanized Sponge         Ever had a large area of fluid you need cleared up? Well the Mechanized Sponge can do this for you, it just needs a little bit of RF power to get the job done. It can clear up to a 97x97 area. As well as the Mechanized Sponge you are going to need 5 additional Sponge blocks. (Use yellow wool if you have world module disabled). Simply place the sponge in the 5 directions away from the central mechanized sponge, this will determine how far it will clear the area out. You then need to supply the sponge with enough RF to clear the area. You can check how much RF is required by right clicking on the mechanized sponge.                      blank|fish|blank             dropletWater|ingotAluminum|dropletWater             minecraft:sponge|baseIron|minecraft:sponge             sponge                                   Lay sponges out like so                  But in water         
                 Give it RF Power...                  And tada!                 Pressure Vessel         Pressure Vessels are simple fluid storage, that can hold an enormous amount of fluid, especially when they are stocked full of storage upgrades. They are handy for keeping blocks in one place, they can also auto-eject so are useful for spreading water from your sluice to your water turbines. They can be any shape or size, and all connected blocks(if placed next to each other correctly, will form one huge tank).                      wheel|blockLapis|wheel             titaniumSheet|normalTank|titaniumSheet             titaniumSheet|sluice|titaniumSheet             pressureVessel                          Geyser         Geysers are simple blocks that will push entities along. They need to be supplied with water or pressurised water. With water they will push entities up to 8 blocks, while with pressurised water they will push up to 16 blocks. They can be turned off with a redstone signal. They are useful for using with fishing nets to push the caught fish in to hoppers. If you place a tank behind them, they will fill up with the water from that tank. If you place an inventory behind them, they will pull items out of the inventory in to the world.                      |water_bucket|             |glass|             redstone|baseIron|redstone             geyser                          F.L.U.D.D.         The Flash Liquidizer Ultra Dousing Device (here on fludd) can be used in block or in item form. In Item form it comes in four modes, hover, squirt, turbo and rocket. You can switch between these modes by pressing the fludd key(default V) + the toggle key(default Y). It needs to be filled with Pressurised Water in order to operate, you can do this by placing it down and filling it, or by placing in the filling slot in a pressure vessel.                      |scubaLens|             plasticYellow|transparent_plastic|plasticYellow             scuba.tank|lifeCore|scuba.tank             fludd                            F.L.U.D.D. Modes         Hover Mode         Holding down space and the fludd key will cause your player to slowly ascend upwards, you can use this to 'hover' across the landscape.         Rocket Mode         Pressing the fludd key, will cause your player to ascend really fast, helping get up to high places.         Turbo Mode         Pressing the fludd key will cause your player to start moving at a very high speed.         Squirt Mode         Pressing the fludd key while in squirt mode, will cause you to squirt water, this water is hot and will damage entities and blocks.                 F.L.U.D.D. Block Form         In block form, the fludd pretty much acts like an advanced geyser, you can control how far it goes and so much more. The main difference is that it will only accept high pressured water. Here's a list of what each upgrade does in a fludd.         Storage Upgrade         Increases the tanks storage capacity.         Hyperkinetic Upgrades         Increases how fast the water is, as in how much speed it adds to entities.         Heating Upgrades         These will turn the water scalding hot, and the hotter the water is, the more damage it will do.         Cooling Upgrades         These make the water freezing cold, and will make the fludds water break blocks, the colder, the more blocks it can break.         Ethereal Upgrade         This causes the waters push effect to become a pull. Pulling items towards it and sucking them in to chests.

replies.author: gooding300
replies.txt_content: 编码问题，请使用notepad++ 将文件编码换成utf8

replies.author: zjqfz
